stories.text:
I mean for retail and talking about 10x or more. Since any other startup deal is not available for retail by law in USA and many countries. So if anyone really wanted to take big financial risk with their own money, only way is/was crypto.

Example how bad it's in stock market is recent tech IPOs and their funny returns since IPO day. Many crypto actually offered public returns, where you could buy in big exchanges follow for months of volatile price, take profit in between until recent crash, so before that it was possible to make it. If one can spend time to understand returns in last years.
stories.title: Does anyone here realize that only possible way to get big ROI is/was crypto?

stories.text:
I recently got married and between me and my wife we have multiple brokerage accounts, 401k accounts, HSA accounts, other investments, credit cards, etc.

I am curious if there are any existing tools that can consolidate this information in one place. I am currently working on setting up an excel sheet, however, this will only give me a snapshot of our finances as they are today. Ideally, I want something that can refresh the data periodically.
stories.title: Ask HN: What tools do you use to keep track of your finances?
